title: Lean Agents Workshop: ChatGPT Apps
description: A practical demo of a three-role AI content stack (Producer -> Art -> Post) for repeatable, reviewable 8-second intro content that scales across teams.
proofLine: A repeatable 3-role stack teaches decision ownership: structure first, visuals second, timing third.
teachingBullets: Watch why single-tool prompts fail for production: roles and handoffs are the control points.
Producer (ChatGPT/OSAN Brand GPT) locks brief, constraints, and disclosure before visuals are created.
Art step generates a clean, readable hero frame first, then motion is applied only after approval gates.
Post/sequence step runs through timing and release checks (legibility, safety, length, margin, consistency) for reusable rollout.

title: Manus Evidence-First Workshop
description: Learn how to evaluate AI agent tools with public evidence, from rubric setup to candidate ranking and a procurement-ready recommendation pack.
proofLine: A repeatable evidence workflow that turns live web research into a defensible short-list and a deploy-ready decision artifact.
teachingBullets: Set a decision rubric first so criteria, weights, and failure rules are fixed before research starts.
Pick eight candidate agents and assign neutral aliases to reduce brand bias while preserving source links.
Build a scored matrix from public evidence, with citations for each score and explicit "Unknown" where data is missing.
Run weighted ranking by scenario, then export the table, recommendations, and validation checklist for real decisions.

title: Ghost Machine
description: Learn stateless AI workflow evolution with high signal and low noise: each state is auditable, explainable, and built from visible evidence rather than hidden magic.
proofLine: A stateless, proof-first simulator where each transition is a testable evidence unit with transparent logic.
teachingBullets: Start with a high-level intent and map it to the first state transition.
Advance through state-by-state snapshots so each step is complete and independently auditable.
Watch checks make tradeoffs explicit before each move is accepted or rejected.
Use the generated proof log to explain why the system moved, paused, or escalated.

title: Vibe-to-PRAL
description: Turn a vague idea into a diagram-first PRAL workflow: structure appears step by step while inputs, gates, and handoffs stay visible and teachable.
proofLine: A guided workflow where uncertain input becomes an explainable PRAL sequence with transparent gates, explicit transitions, and understandable output.
teachingBullets: Start with a vague intent and define objective, policy scope, and quality threshold.
Advance step-by-step as each validation gate confirms intent before progression.
Watch the diagram map intake to transformation, routing, and handoff with explicit state transitions.
Compare speed, confidence, and risk tradeoffs before each finalized action.

title: VPN Cost Lab
description: Estimate AI deployment spend step-by-step: each request path, policy rule, and routing tradeoff stays visible so teams can reason from evidence to decision.
proofLine: A presenter-friendly cost simulator that makes spend logic, policy checks, and tradeoffs explicit for fast teaching adoption.
teachingBullets: Start with a concrete cost scenario: users, latency targets, and safety guardrails.
Compare request, policy, and routing choices while watching spend impact appear in real time.
Review why safety or policy checks are triggered before high-cost decisions are finalized.
Approve final outputs using outcome quality, confidence, and total cost tradeoffs.

title: Neural Glass
description: Learn how a neural network turns raw signals into predictions in 90 seconds, with concepts, weights, and confidence made visible.
proofLine: A proof-first walkthrough from inputs to concepts to outcomes, designed for zero-prior-knowledge learners while preserving enough technical structure for engineers.
teachingBullets: Start with raw customer signals and let learners map inputs to outcomes.
Observe how adaptive weighting shifts focus between features.
Watch hidden concepts become visible as labels like Loyal, Frustrated, and Engaged.
Track how shifts in inputs affect churn prediction confidence in real time.

title: Kinetic Proof
description: Learn how evidence-heavy governance flows work under pressure: validation, schema checks, and decision outcomes are visible end-to-end.
proofLine: A low-noise, evidence-first simulation where each stage is auditable, deterministic, and directly tied to operational AI outcomes.
teachingBullets: Input events enter a proof-first flow and stay visible through each validation stage.
Validation gates show schema and policy checks before any move is applied.
Decision outcomes report why a state passed, warned, or was blocked.
Quality and trust improve through traceable, explicit status signals.

title: Policy Gatekeeper
description: Turn policy checks into a visual routing system you can teach from: policy tickets, rule evaluation, escalation, and outcome signals stay visible all the way through.
proofLine: A visual policy-routing environment for teaching rule design with explicit escalation, guardrails, and visible decision outcomes.
teachingBullets: Tickets enter as requests and are routed by policy lanes.
Policy checks are surfaced before any move is applied.
Weak-confidence decisions are explicitly escalated for review.
Outcome status updates show why a policy route was chosen or rejected.

title: The Kinetic Kitchen 2.0
description: Watch an AI agent workflow as a restaurant order: intake, routing, escalation, and completion. No code, no jargon. Learners see decisions, guardrails, edge-case handling, and KPI behavior as the order moves.
proofLine: A compact, visible workflow simulation that makes routing, guardrails, and outcomes explicit so learners can follow policy reasoning and spot failure modes quickly.
teachingBullets: Order enters as a request and travels through stations.
Route decisions are visible and explainable.
Escalation is explicit when confidence is low.
Throughput and accuracy are tracked as behavior changes.

title: Kitchen X-Ray
description: A visual AI safety simulator that makes restaurant-style controls explicit before every routing decision.
proofLine: Expose risk hotspots and policy controls in a visual flow so safety decisions are visible before action.
teachingBullets: Start with a scenario and define scope, ownership, and failure boundaries.
Step through role-level controls that gate each routing choice.
Review warnings as first-class signals before state transitions are accepted.
Close with readiness checks so the model behavior is auditable and coachable.

title: The AI Kitchen
description: A practical readiness sequence where AI workflows are checked, controlled, and approved before deployment.
proofLine: Validate ideas through risk checkpoints and readiness gates so leadership can trust the launch path.
teachingBullets: Capture initiative context and define the business guardrails before runtime.
Select controls and owners, then watch risk handling evolve through explicit checkpoints.
Track confidence, risk, and compliance signals as deployment readiness changes.
Finalize with one-page outcomes that map choices to outcomes and next actions.
